Sentencas: Scandium stabilized zirconium (10ScSZ) thin ceramic films were deposited by e-beam evaporation of (ZrO2)(0.90)(Sc2O3)(0.10) micro powder (particle size 0.5 divided by 0.7 mu m).
Titulo: Scandium stabilized zirconium thin films formation by e-beam technique

Sentencas: The influence of deposition rate on formed thin films microstructure and electrical properties was studied.
Titulo: Scandium stabilized zirconium thin films formation by e-beam technique

Sentencas: 10ScSZ thin films were deposited on two types of different substrates: optical quartz (SiO2) and Alloy-600 (Fe-Ni-Cr) substrates.
Titulo: Scandium stabilized zirconium thin films formation by e-beam technique

Sentencas: Deposition rate was changed from 2 to 16 angstrom/s to test its influence on thin film formation and its properties.
Titulo: Scandium stabilized zirconium thin films formation by e-beam technique

Sentencas: The microstructure of formed 10ScSZ thin ceramic films was studied by X-ray diffraction (XRD) and scanning electron microscopy (SEM).
Titulo: Scandium stabilized zirconium thin films formation by e-beam technique

Sentencas: Electrical parameters of formed thin ceramics were investigated in the frequency range from 0.1 Hz to 1.0 MHz (in temperature range from 473 to 873 K).
Titulo: Scandium stabilized zirconium thin films formation by e-beam technique

Sentencas: The ionic conductivity of the deposited electrolyte 10ScSZ thin films was determined by impedance spectroscopy.
Titulo: Scandium stabilized zirconium thin films formation by e-beam technique

Sentencas: It was determined that the deposition rate (in range from 2 to 16 angstrom/s) has influence on crystallite size.
Titulo: Scandium stabilized zirconium thin films formation by e-beam technique

Sentencas: It increases by increasing the deposition rate from 18.4 to 26.9 nm.
Titulo: Scandium stabilized zirconium thin films formation by e-beam technique

Sentencas: The XRD measurements show that the formed 10ScSZ thin films do not repeat the crystallographic phase of the initial evaporated powder material-it is changes from rhombohedra (initial powder) to cubic (the formed thin films).
Titulo: Scandium stabilized zirconium thin films formation by e-beam technique
